bioghist.p: Robert Adrain (1775-1843) was a scientist and mathematician, considered one of the most brilliant mathematical minds of the time in America. He is chiefly remembered for his formulation of the method of least squares, published in 1808.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of published items on mathematical topics by various authors, all of which appear to be duplicates of items held in the University of Pennsylvania Library or other libraries.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
